author: Emirates News Agency (WAM)
title: UAE- Italian Ambassador briefed on Khalifa Fund's experience in entrepreneurship
text:
(MENAFN - Emirates News Agency (WAM)) ABU DHABI 3rd September 2015 (WAM) -- The Khalifa Fund for Enterprise Development recently received Liborio Stellino Italian Ambassador to the UAE and his accompanying delegation at its headquarters in Abu Dhabi and briefed the visitors about its experiences in spreading the culture of entrepreneurship among Emiratis by supporting Small and Medium-sized Enterprises SMEs. 
Hussain Jassim Al Nowais Chairman of the Khalifa Fund and other senior management officials met with the Italian delegation and discussed ways to improve the performance of the SMEs sector in the UAE and to benefit from the Italian experiences in this field as Italy is one of the first countries in the world to have wide experience in the SMEs sector as it has more than five million companies in the category. 
Speaking on the occasion Mr. Al Nowais said "It is very important to strengthen cooperation with the Italian side and to adopt mechanisms to transfer knowledge and experience to SMEs in the UAE as well as the technology and techniques to enable those projects to develop and compete both locally and internationally." 
"The Khalifa Fund will in the next phase focus on innovative projects and the quality of the ones which require technology. We are hoping to work together with Italian companies in this area" he explained and added "The fund was able in a short period of time to achieve much most notably being the raising of awareness in young generations of the importance of entrepreneurship and to encourage innovation and creativity. That contributes effectively in creating the most suitable environment for the SMEs sector to grow." 
"The fund succeeded in harmonising the financial technical and training needs of entrepreneurs to enable them to start up promising projects. One thing that distinguishes the fund is that it started from where others have ended as we identified the obstacles they face and work out how to avoid them which helps us to design the appropriate programmes from the economic and social needs of Abu Dhabi" the Chairman of Khalifa Fund explained. 
The Italian Ambassador welcomed the cooperation with the Khalifa Fund saying "Italy is keen to provide all experiences it has that might support the SMEs sector. We encourage frequent visits and training to open dialogue between Italian and local enterprises to exchange knowledge and experience." 
The Italian Ambassador also visited the permanent exhibition for Sougha products a Khalifa Fund for Enterprise Development programme which includes handcrafted heritage products. He admired the products which he said reflect the Emirati heritage but with modern taste.
